item.title: Air pollution due to no enforcement of illegal parking, 12th June
item.description:
Dear Westminster Council, I am writing to raise a serious and ongoing concern regarding congestion on Harewood Avenue, which I believe is primarily caused by persistent illegal parking on the double yellow lines alongside the Landmark Hotel. I have been a resident of Manor House, NW1 5NP, for over 20 years and regularly park in the resident bays around Marylebone Station. Daily, I experience delays of 15 to 20 minutes while queuing in traffic that backs up from the A501 junction along Harewood Avenue as far as Hayes Place. This congestion frequently spills over into Harewood Row and Melcombe Place, further exacerbating the issue. The root cause of this bottleneck is usually a single or multiple vehicles parked illegally on the double yellow lines on Harewood Avenue, forcing all traffic into one lane instead of two. The problem becomes even worse when large vehicles such as buses or lorries attempt to enter the queue from Harewood Row or Melcombe Place, or when taxis are stationary in the designated waiting bay opposite Marylebone Station on harewood avenue and mopeds are parked illegally in the adjacent loading bay, preventing lorries from accessing it altogether as there isn’t the full length of the loading bay available to them. In addition to the impact on drivers, this issue poses a health risk to the thousands of pedestrians who use Marylebone Station daily. At peak times, traffic idles with engines running, emitting fumes directly into an area with extremely high footfall. Over the period from March to May, I submitted the following reports concerning illegal parking that caused particularly severe congestion outside the landmark hotel with photos: • CAS-1314029-J7P9C8 – 24/03/25 at 13:04 • CAS-1316474-R4B2Q5 – 26/03/25 at 13:46 • CAS-1325175-Q6X9V1 – 03/04/25 at 13:15 • CAS-1364741-T1X9G3 – 21/05/25 at 16:10

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-14, Lisson Grove, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massively overhanging public tree blocking public using public footpath, 12th June
item.description:
The tree in question is overhanging and almost touching the pavement. People cannot use the footpath and have to walk on the edge of paving or even road to walk around, massive risk to public safety. Tree located next to the bridge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
